entry.title: Delays at key border crossing for Armenia‚Äôs trade with Russia to be reduced: Business Week Armenia

media:group.media:title: Delays at key border crossing for Armenia‚Äôs trade with Russia to be reduced: Business Week Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs edition of CivilNet‚Äôs business digest:
üìçLengthy delays at the border crossing between Georgia and Russia, reportedly due to malfunctioning X-ray machines, are expected to be reduced in the coming days. üìçMoney transfers to Armenian banks by individuals outside the country nearly tripled year-on-year in the first quarter, hitting more than $1.5 billion. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Central Bank decided to keep its key refinancing rate unchanged, at 10.75%, as inflation in the country continues to ease from last year‚Äôs peak. üìçUpwards of $760 million in taxes flowed into Armenia‚Äôs state coffers in April, marking a new record for the country‚Äôs highest tax collection rate in a single month.

entry.title: Pashinyan to head to Moscow as Armenia-Azerbaijan talks conclude in US

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan to head to Moscow as Armenia-Azerbaijan talks conclude in US
media:group.media:description:
üìçAfter multiday peace talks in the United States between delegations from Armenia and Azerbaijan, the two countries‚Äô foreign ministries released identical statements noting that their positions on a number of key issues remain distant. üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, currently in Prague on an official visit, announced that he will travel to Moscow next week. üìçArmenian Parliamentary Speaker Alen Simonyan discussed Turkey‚Äôs move to close its airspace to Armenian airliners at a meeting with his Turkish counterpart in Ankara. üìçNagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs Sarsang reservoir, its largest, has almost dried up due to hydropower overuse prompted by Azerbaijan‚Äôs ongoing blockade of the Lachin corridor.

entry.title: Do Pashinyan‚Äôs predecessors share the responsibility for the 2020 war defeat?

media:group.media:title: Do Pashinyan‚Äôs predecessors share the responsibility for the 2020 war defeat?
media:group.media:description:
Armenia‚Äôs former education minister and Republican Party member, Armen Ashotyan, sat down with CivilNet to reflect on the 5th anniversary of the 2018 Velvet Revolution, which catapulted Nikol Pashinyan to power. Ashotyan discussed Pashinyan‚Äôs predecessors' share of responsibility for Armenia‚Äôs defeat in the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war, if the revolution was really non-violent and why opinion polls continue to show Pashinyan‚Äôs Civil Contract having a wide lead over all other political parties in the country.

media:group.media:title: TURKEY VOTES - Who is Kemal Kƒ±lƒ±√ßdaroƒülu?
media:group.media:description:
In CivilNet‚Äôs latest interview with Aras Editor-in-Chief Rober Kopta≈ü in the run-up to Turkey‚Äôs general elections, Kopta≈ü discussed the leader of Turkey‚Äôs main opposition coalition, Kemal Kƒ±lƒ±√ßdaroƒülu, his history, and his ability to put together a broad opposition coalition.
